content.rendered:
The Commercial Section of U.S. Embassy in Ghana, or the Foreign Commercial Service (FCS), is the trade promotion arm of the U.S. Department of Commerce’s International Trade Administration.  It works to advance U.S. commercial interests in foreign markets with an eye towards growing U.S. employment through exports and inward investment.  It employs consulting, market intelligence, commercial diplomacy, advocacy, and a suite of fee-based business development services to help companies expand into new markets, grow market share for U.S. exports, overcome barriers to trade, and facilitate investment into the United States.  Website: https://www.trade.gov/ghana

Contact us to connect with our staff of sectoral and trade specialists and to find out about the services we provide to connect you with local partners in the market, set up targeted meetings, promote your goods or services, or do due diligence on potential partners.

See our Country Commercial Guide for Ghana  for a comprehensive overview of market conditions and best prospects for U.S. business.

See our Market Intelligence Reports on Ghana

Find out more about our SelectUSA program and annual SelectUSA investment summit to investors know what they need to invest in the United States.

Commercial Section

U.S. Embassy Ghana
No. 24 Fourth Circular Road
Cantonments, Accra
Phone: +233 (0) 30 274 1870
General Inquiries: office.accra@trade.gov
